content.body:
Hello, I'm not sure if this is the correct place to ask but somehow I ended up here ðŸ¤£

Question: In MDN .showModal() is defined to be "Interaction outside the dialog is blocked and the content outside it is rendered inert." but when I am using <dialog> with .showModal(), this is not true. Should I file a new issue in Github for this or am I just misusing it?

* Hello, I'm not sure if this is the correct place to ask but somehow I ended up here ðŸ¤£

Question: In MDN .showModal() is defined to be "Interaction outside the dialog is blocked and the content outside it is rendered inert." but when I am using <dialog> inside an Iframe with .showModal(), this is not true. Should I file a new issue in Github for this or am I just misusing it?

m.new_content.body:
Hello, I'm not sure if this is the correct place to ask but somehow I ended up here ðŸ¤£

Question: In MDN .showModal() is defined to be "Interaction outside the dialog is blocked and the content outside it is rendered inert." but when I am using <dialog> inside an Iframe with .showModal(), this is not true. Should I file a new issue in Github for this or am I just misusing it?

content.body: It seems like what the doc defines as "outside" is nearest <html>, or something similar, so dialog triggered from iframe does not inert content outside of the iframe which gives unexpected focus experience to the user.

Tabbing on a page with iframe jumps in and out of the iframe so having partial content(iframe) be inert for a dialog experience seems odd to me.

Hopefully, I'm just using it wrong or misunderstanding.
